description.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, children, adolescent girls and boys, women and other disadvantaged groups meaningfully participate in decision-making bodies

sector.narrative: Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents

description.narrative: Other General Services support to civil society

title.narrative: Nepal United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, children, adolescent girls and boys, women and other disadvantaged groups meaningfully participate in decision-making bodies

description.narrative: The Local Governance Act 2017 (LGA) authorized local governments to register child clubs at municipalities and encouraged the formation of child clubs/networks as a viable strategy for children's participation in local governance. UNICEF provided technical support to develop related guidelines for all 753 local governments. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: # of child club network (District, Municipality and VDC level) capacitated on CFLG to influence local governance decision making processes

baseline.value: MFWR (10 districts), ER (1 district), CWR (1 district)

target.value: 2017:District level child club network: (15 districts), Municipality level (7 Municipalities), VDC level (800)

actual.value: 2017:Target to have district level child club networks in 15 UNICEF focused districts, 7 Municipalities and 800 VDCs met. Status Report on Children prepared by Central Child Welfare Board, Government of Nepal highlighted the existence of 22,628 child clubs (200,649 girls and 231,710 boys as members) acro

title.narrative: # of local bodies (DDC, Municipalities, VDCs) that have incorporated children

baseline.value: MFWR (20 VDCs in 5 districts), ER (32 VDCs in 4 districts), CWR (10 VDCs in 3 districts)

actual.value: 2017:Bal bhelas were completed in 1000 Village Development Committees of 29 districts of Nepal. 68,500 children participated in Bal bhelas (47 per cent girls). After the bal bhelas children submitted their demands to local governments and all 193 local governments included children's demand in their loca

title.narrative: % of children/adolescent girl membership in local governance structures (CFLG committees, IPC, WCF, DSMC)

baseline.value: One boy and one girl in MFWR (140 VDCs in 12 districts and 3 municipalities), ER (92 VDCs in 4 districts and 4 municipalities), CWR (27 VDCs in 3 districts and 4 municipalities)

target.value: 2017:Representation of children in CFLG/IPC/WCFs/DSMC in 15 priority districts, 7 municipalities and 800 VDCs

actual.value: 2017:68,500 children participated in bal bhelas (47 per cent girls); 63,284 (50 per cent girls) children participated in the special planning processes of Gaoupalika/Municipality Assemblies organised by local governments.
